heading: bad dog
subheading: police in the southwestern german town of bad urach ruled out both suicide and foul play in the shotgun death of a 51-year-old hunter, whose body was found alongside his car earlier this week. left with no other scenario, the polizei concluded that the man -- who was not identified in news reports -- must have been killed when his dog jumped onto the shotgun laying on the front passenger's seat, causing it to discharge. the nra may want to amend its assertion that "guns don't kill people. people kill people."
author: wired staff
text: police in the southwestern german town of bad urach ruled out both suicide and foul play in the shotgun death of a 51-year-old hunter, whose body was found alongside his car earlier this week. left with no other scenario, the  polizei concluded that the man -- who was not identified in news reports -- must have been killed when his dog jumped onto the shotgun laying on the front passenger's seat, causing it to discharge. the nra may want to amend its assertion that "guns don't kill people. people kill people."
